title: Normalize ignore-region coordinates to viewport
body:
Legacy: design-parity-checker-039
Type: bug
Created: 2025-12-14T10:08:30.441388+01:00
Legacy Status: closed
Legacy Priority: 2

Ignore-region rectangles are interpreted after resizing screenshots to the viewport, so small coords (e.g., 4x4) do not cover the rendered 1440x900 image. Need to normalize region coordinates to the viewport/screenshot size or accept normalized percentages so masking matches the intended area without giant rectangles.

title: Fix main.rs API mismatches blocking build
body:
Legacy: design-parity-checker-08r
Type: bug
Created: 2025-12-13T22:31:26.119439+01:00
Legacy Status: closed
Legacy Priority: 0

main.rs has API mismatches: (1) image_to_normalized_view signature wrong (takes &str not &Path), (2) figma_to_normalized_view takes &FigmaClient and &FigmaRenderOptions, not individual args, (3) FigmaRenderOptions.viewport should be Option. Blocking full binary build.

title: Figma image download uses unauthenticated reqwest::get
body:
Legacy: design-parity-checker-3qt
Type: bug
Created: 2025-12-13T22:17:50.771689+01:00
Legacy Status: closed
Legacy Priority: 1

Figma client builds an authenticated reqwest client but download_image bypasses it with bare reqwest::get, losing headers/timeouts/proxies. If the signed image URL requires auth or tighter timeouts, downloads may fail silently. Fix by reusing the configured client with per-request timeouts and add tests for error propagation.

title: Implement combined score calculation
body:
Legacy: design-parity-checker-5se
Type: task
Created: 2025-12-13T21:40:49.768761+01:00
Deps: design-parity-checker-n0q, design-parity-checker-d8h, design-parity-checker-wex, design-parity-checker-ywj, design-parity-checker-z95
Legacy Status: closed
Legacy Priority: 1

Combine metrics: similarity = w_pixel*0.35 + w_layout*0.25 + w_typography*0.15 + w_color*0.15 + w_content*0.10. Handle missing metrics by redistributing weights. Implement configurable weights via CLI flags.

figma_to_normalized_view accepts an optional viewport but never uses it; returned NormalizedView width/height always come from the exported PNG dimensions, so callers cannot request a specific viewport or scaled dimensions.
